page.title: 12Interview - local character
page.content:
INTERVIEW WITH A CHARACTER WALTER FOX
WALTER FOX WORKS IN CLEARWELL CEMETARY.HISJOB IS TO LOOK AFTER THE GRAVES AND TIDY THE GARDENS.HE HAS CUT DOWN MOST OF THE LONG GRASSWHERE SNAKES HAD BEEN AND MADE FLOWER BEDS ALONG THE SIDES OF THE WALLS.HE HAS BEEN DOING HIS JOB FOR 3 YEARS AND GOES EVERY DAY TO THE CEMETERY AT 8 OCLOCK IN THE MORNING AND COMES BACK AT 4.30 IN THE EVENING. HIS FATHER AND GRANDFATHER AUNTIE AND UNCLE ARE ALL BURIED THERE.THE OLDEST GRAVE IN THE CEMETERY IS THAT OF A VICARS WIFE WHO DIED IN 1836.THE VICAR OF THE CHURCH IS DAVID ADDISON. THE MOST POPULAR GRAVE WAS PAIN FAMILY,EIGHT OF THE FAMILY WERE BURIED THERE SIDE BY SIDE.THE BIGGEST GRAVE HAD 16 PEOPLE IN. THE CHURCH WAS REBUILT IN 1865.
